Reviews.Title: “Car got scratched at their valet parking”
Reviews.Author: Angel Z
Reviews.Content: I've just visited the Windsor Arms Hotel for high tea. I was with my fiancé and we gave the car to the valet guy once we arrived. Tea lasted for like two hours. When another valet guy drove our car out, we could clearly see a white scratch close to the door handle on the driver side. And there is some polish on top of the scratch. Even the valet guy said that someone was trying to buffer off the scratch. We waited for the manager to solve the problem but then after a while the receptionist told us that they have no manager on duty at the time. I mean what kind of hotel would have no manager on duty in the middle of the day! The next day, the manager called us and said their security camera didn't capture anything came into contact with our car so they can't do anything. All I know is that my car just got cleaned and was spotless before going to the Windsor Arms and passing to the valet driver!

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to deliver.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Windsor Arms many times with my husband, my daughter and with extended family. On this occasion, my daughter and I decided to spend the weekend downtown. As always, the Windsor Arms offered impeccable and friendly service from the doorman to the front desk staff to the restaurant and bar staff. Comfortable beds, chic decor, cool bar. Excellent location for Bloor St. and Yorkville shopping.

Reviews.Title: “I See Why the Stars Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Kirochka
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a suite at the Windsor Arms Hotel, which is the most comfortable and luxuriously understated hotel room I have ever stayed in. Everything worked beautifully -- the jacuzzi, the sound system, the wireless internet, and the staff were attentive. I love the "Russian Tea Room" -- red walls, gilt framed photographs of Nicholas II and his family, beautiful china -- although I did not get a chance to take afternoon tea there. The location for high end shopping could not be better -- Escada is across the street, Holt Renfrew a block or two away. Two small criticisms-- the the breakfast buffet was in a dark room, and I felt the waiters were much more attentive to middle-aged male guests in suits, than to this middle-aged woman guest in jeans. And on leaving, the bellhop and manager summonsed a cab to take me to the airport. There was a "transaction" between the taxi driver and the manager -- which I subsequently learned from the taxi driver was the hotel bellhop demanding a $5 kickback for the fare to the airport. Pretty sleazy for a hotel that charges top prices and caters to the "elite".

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tpal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Windsor Arms over the weekend and right from the first experience with the doorman and valet parking; we knew this hotel would be perfect. The check-in was very quick and we were on our way to our room in under 5 minutes. The ambionce of this hotel is very special. Everything was very clean and well maintained. We had breakfast in the hotel and it was scrumptious! I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family and we definitely return for another stay! Thank you to all the staff for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Duncan T
Reviews.Content: Having practically "lived" in hotels during my business career, I can assure you that you will enjoy the Windsor Arms. You can always tell from the attitude of the first staff you meet, from the Doorman to Reception. I stayed there over 40 years ago and many times since, and have never been disappointed. My standards, I admit, are high....I am not easily pleased when it comes to hotel service. I stayed in the Toronto Four Seasons when it opened as the Hyatt, the current Hilton when it opened as the Hotel Toronto and prior to it becoming the Westin, and even the Westbury when it opened. In short, I have a broad base for comparison, and I agree with Conde Nast that the WA is the #1 hotel in Toronto. The attention to detail is outstanding, from explaining the room functions to the personal weather report. All the staff are very pleasant and accommodating....the rooms luxurious (the Art Shoppe), very clean and quiet. Don't hesitate to book an adventure...you'll be very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: billgayle167
Reviews.Content: We visited this lovely hotel for the first time, to celebrate our anniversary. We were upgraded to a lovely suite and had a personal butler, who instructed us on how to use all the wonderful amenities. We were presented with a lovely fruit tray and chocolates. The king bed was so comfortable! The hotel itself is very elegant-a throw back to an extravagant earlier period in time. Each one of the staff was incredibly friendly and quick to help with anything you asked. Highly recommend this hotel for a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “afternoon tea - a wonderful indulgence at the Windsor Arms”
Reviews.Author: Kai-HT
Reviews.Content: what a better way to celebrate a special occasion than having afternoon or high tea at the lovely Windsor Arms. We come here at least once a year (during winter) & it's always been the best. The sandwiches and pastries are fresh & delicious and the elegant and cozy tea room itself with its fireplace always transports me to another world. Make sure that you make reservations well in advance (there are 2 sittings )& that you book it for the original tea room with the fireplace otherwise the experience is just not the same. It's a great experience for young and old alike (we bring the whole family including kids). The service is also impeccable. Don't forget to ask for a doggie bag!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan F
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I spend many nights a year in hotels, and the Windsor Arms in Toronto has to be one of the best. From the second you walk in, you feel like you're in a place that truly cares and will look after every one of your needs, and they really do. The suite I was given was spectacular, and totally renovated since my last visit. The classical design with contemporary finishes truly made my suite a pleasure, and unique experience to be in. It even had a Baby Grand Piano in it! Their salt-water Indoor pool with a fireplace also made for a great way to relax after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!,”
Reviews.Author: joanne777
Reviews.Content: decided to splurge and stay at this beautiful hotel.From Dave the doorman to Damon the bellhop everything here is done with warmth and to the nines. every room has an instrument in it some have organs or baby grands.!Ours had a guitar. paid 300 including taxes breakfast for 2 and parking.One block from Bloor Torontos answer to 5th Avenue. Did not get to use spa or pool or bar but everything here is perfect. great for a romantic weekend . Rooms very comfortable beautiful bathrooms bathrobes slippers welcome truffles definitely will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: lewmjbo
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas Eve and Christmas day at the Windsor Arms. It was delightful. The staff were attentive and friendly. The Christmas buffett was excellent ( a bit smaller than previous years ). Our suite was lovely and the sweet treat and welcome back letter were a nice touch. It is a a new tradition for our family to go there every other year for the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, With A Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: Jack R
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Windsor Arms on a recent trip to Toronto. Their location in the middle of Toronto's shopping district is fantastic, and being nestled away on a side street seemed to make things quieter after a long day. Their extremely well equipped gym was also a great way to unwind. Finally, and most importantly, are their staff. They manage to anticipate every need you could have, and respond to any request in a timely, knowledgable, and personable fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise In The Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Louisa P
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Arms is literally a paradise in the heart of downtown Toronto. From the moment you walk through their doors, you really feel like you're in a special place. The Hotel is beautifully decorated with old world English style charm, and the attentiveness of the staff takes it one step further. The room was very large and spacious, and we loved the freshly baked cookies left for us upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Demos S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a night's stay for a romantic getaway weekend, and were totally blown away by the attentiveness of the staff. These are people who really enjoy what they are doing and it shows. Everyone had a smile on their face, and the atmosphere was congenial, relaxed, and exceptionally friendly. We've stayed at many of the hotels in Toronto, and the Windsor Arms is truly incomparable. Our highest recommendation for an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Arms Hotel is an oasis in the middle of downtown Toronto Their staff are extremely friendly and genuinely care how your day was, and having a butler to take care of any needs 24/7 is wonderful. The room was very beautiful and spacious, and I was impressed to find that they have a Restaurant (with a great breakfast -- complimentary) , Bar, Spa and serve an excellent traditional Afternoon Tea, despite only being a 30-room hotel. I'd dfinitely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto's best”
Reviews.Author: FansofEurope
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps our 10th visit to the Windsor Arms and we will keep returning. There have been room renovations since our last visit and some nice new furniture additions. They were not really needed though. This is a lovely small hotel in a prime location which does everything really well. Superb quiet luxurious rooms, and impeccable service from everyone. Wonderful buffet breakfast! Friendly and not at all snobby. My wife and I have been fortunate to stay in some of the best hotels in London, Paris and the South of France and this hotel is as good as any. Well done Windsor Arms you continue to be the best hotel in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for High-End Shopping”
Reviews.Author: D_home885
Reviews.Content: This New York style brownstone hotel is perfectly located on a quiet side-street off Toronto's 'golden mile'. I have stayed here 6-7 times during the past 2 years and it always feels like home to me. Since I travel for business 5 months/year I like a hotel to feel like home with added service and comforts. The suites are beautifully furnished with top quality and always fresh and comfortable. The sound systems in each room is set up to attach my iPod to play through the built-in speakers that I can control separately in each room. The wifi internet is super fast and the TV was fully loaded with 100s of channel available â€” even the pay-per-vu was freely available during my most recent stay in November 2011. The little touches make all the difference such as the fresh baked samples treats placed in the room daily along with the New York Times and Canada's 2 main newspapers.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Lee R
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for years...and the staff and hotel and location are perfect...whatever you need, they will do...starting with Kevin....

Reviews.Title: “Classic and quiet”
Reviews.Author: GAMercer
Reviews.Content: Well-furnished, very quiet despite central location, superbly attentive staff (a special nod to Tim who handles valet parking and more). Great breakfast! By no means trendy or faddish, this is an Old School hotel in the best sense of the phrase. We visited as a family so cannot provide insights as to business services or even fitness activities, but it was great for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Allan N
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in an excellent location. The room was large, beautifully furnished and appointed. Very comfortable bed with new linens. Everything looks clean and brand new. Muscial instruments are hung in the room for guests to play with. If you're staying over a weekend, have the afternoon tea service. It's well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Event”
Reviews.Author: Martha H
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a wonderful overnight stay at this intimate hotel. We were guests at an evening wedding where the ambience and food met perfection along with the beautiful bride and handsome groom.Saturday brunch was relaxed with no one hurring us out the door.The location is superb whether it be Bloor Street browsing,culture at the ROM or people watching in Yorkville that one wishes to do.Of course,the hotel staff was friendly,helpful and most accommodating in meeting any need.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny luxurious oasis in a metropolitan setting”
Reviews.Author: Chris1420
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, beautifully decorated, and great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea at the Windsor Arms Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguru2009
Reviews.Content: As a Brit in Canada, I was looking forward to a traditional afternoon tea experience, fine finger sandwiches, scones and a wide selection of teas. What we had was exactly that. The decor was beautiful, although my tea pot had at least 3 rather large chips in it. I don't mean to sound like a snob however, if you're selling Afternoon tea at the price they are, I wouldn't expect a tea pot with chips. The food was delicious, 2 scones per person (one plain, one raisin), 3 different sandwiches with each person having 2 (chicken, smoked salmon and caviar, vegetable pate) and 4 petit fours. The service was rather disappointing, we had extreme difficulty catching the eye of our waiter to get more hot water for our tea and cream for our scones (which never arrived). When we askes for a clean knife so we were using the same knife for andwiches as we were for cream he looked thoroughly perplexed. We had the complete tea which included a glass of sherry - a very nice touch, although with the total price at just over $100 fo the 2 of us I did think that this was a price a little too high for the overall experience. I think this experience would be best if you're trying to impress people with a cultural experience. I've marked the overall experience as very good as the quality of the food and tea selection made up for the other down points.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique! Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyphil47
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 days at the Windsor Arms on busines, and perfection sums up the property perfectly.The staff are extremely attentive, and their rooms are very quiet, large and most importantly comfortable. The "Butler's Closet" was also an excellent and unique addition..Overall, the Windsor Arms staff and faciltiy really make you feel at home -- if not better. Definitely reccomend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jacktomary
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at the Windsor Arms over Thanksgiving and had a wonderful stay. The Junior Suite was very comfortable for us to gather as a family without having to perch on the end of a bed to visit. The location is perfect on a quiet side street with easy access to all amenities. We were in Toronto to visit family and friends and so only really used the hotel as a home base but expect to enjoy some of those facilities on our next visit. Every interaction I had with the staff and service they provided was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Star studded lobby and restaurant was a nice extra touch”
Reviews.Author: Geoff S
Reviews.Content: Getting a reservation at the Windsor Arms wasn't an easy task during the Film Festival. But we managed to get in and, what a stay. The rooms have just been re done. Very sophisticated and classical, yet a very comfy feel. The Spa and the Tea Room were a true joy. Had a fabulous facial and massage before we went out on the town. When we came back to the Hotel, "Lounge 22" was a great place to grab a night cap and sit next to several A listers. I am not one for dropping names, but, gotta admit, it was fun sitting next to real celebrities. The staff was really helpful and friendly and my wife, being a vegan, was able to order of their full a la carte vegan menu. She could not stop raving about being in a nice environment, yet being able to eat healthy. Can't wait to return. Windsor Arms is now our home in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay anywhere, ever!”
Reviews.Author: JPepper_10
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent three days at the Windsor Arms at the time of our wedding. We have never had a better hotel experience, and we have each been staying in hotels for a long, long time. Location: The hotel is on a quiet street which nonetheless is just a block from the the shopping bustle of Bloor Street. Room: On arrival we were told we would have a complimentary upgrade to a suite. Our suite was very quiet, very comfortable and enabled us to entertain family in some style the day following our wedding. Our bed was extremely comfortable, with wonderful linens, though we thought the pillows a bit hard. There was a music system through all the rooms. The bathroom was spa-like, with a quiet whirlpool tub and a very good shower. (Unaccountably, the toilet flush was alarmingly loud, more like an airplane unit than anything you would find on the ground.) The living room was very comfortably furnished and attractively laid out. (The mini-bar not so good: very small and no ice-presumably most of the punters would use the butler service, of which more anon). One really thrilling feature to us was that the windows all opened a few inches. Very pleasant during warm September days and nights. Parking: The only parking is valet parking, and except for one mix-up it was always quick and convenient. There are unlimited in-and-out privileges. If valet is too steep for your taste, there are several public lots and garages near-by. Staff: The staff were cheerful, courteous and unerringly professional. There is an astonishing butler service at the hotel. On our arrival, the butler took us up and showed us in detail what our room had, how things worked, and he told us what services were available. Tell the front desk what papers you want, and if they don't have them, they will go out and get them for you in the morning. Every afternoon, a plate of bed-time biscuits is delivered to the butler's pantry in your room. Shoes are polished, glasses delivered, your room is left alone until you want it cleaned, then it's done promptly and well: it's all there. Our stay included a breakfast on the premises, simple but excellent. When my wife couldn't find just the yogurt she wanted, they made sure it was available the next day without being asked to. The Windsor Arms is no one's idea of budget accomodation and is out of our usual league. But before we left we resolved to be back there each year on our anniversary if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mtl_traveller6475
Reviews.Content: Each time I go to Toronto I stay at the Windsor Arms and each time I thoroughly enjoy my stay there. The rooms are spacious and very nicely decorated - classic meets modern - and the staff is very friendly and attentive. The location, right in the heart of Bloor, is terrific and is close to the best shopping and restaurants. Recently, I had the opportunity to experience the afternoon tea at the hotel. The experience was excellent, as was the atmosphere. Windsor Arms is by far one of the nicest hotels in Toronto and should be your top choice when traveling to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Continuously Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Canadas Walk Of... C
Reviews.Content: Canadaâ€™s Walk of Fame celebrates and honours Canadian excellence. Five years ago we selected Windsor Arms as our official hotel. We host all of our media events there. We have our offsite planning sessions there. We have all of our client events there. We house all of our celebrities there. We chose The Windsor Arms because we wanted a boutique hotel, in the middle of Torontoâ€™s fashionable Yorkville District, with consistent quality and personal service. George and the WA staff continue to impress us and surpass our expectations. They have all of the services that our discerning clients and celebrities require. There are a number of good hotel choices in Toronto. We chose The Windsor Arms because we continue to be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Craig F
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Toronto, and when I do come back, I'm definitely staying at the Windsor Arms. The hotel is in a great location and their staff are extremely attentive to everything that you could possibly think of. Apparently they are only 28 rooms, and this seemed to help contribute to the intimate atmosphere / vibe / personal touch in the hotel that you just can't get a bigger property. But, they didn't compromise on the facilities / services. Their spa was very well equipped with very good gym equipment and an indoor fireside saltwater pool.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Diane180981
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is a lovely old fashioned oasis but with the very latest facilities. A little haven in the centre of a busy city. Very centrally located with high end and chain store shopping very close by. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, who always greeted us like old friends when we returned from a day out and Angelika organised trips out for us via email before our arrival. The 'complimentary continental breakfast' we were offered is coffee, juice and a small piece of cake so the description is perhaps misleading for those of us used to something more under that heading. Nevertheless, it is complimentary. I foudn the bed a little hard but that is subjective. A terrific find that I couldn't recommend more highly.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: sf15er
Reviews.Content: Looking for an in-town getaway weekend, my husband and I stayed at the Windsor Arms. The hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of Yorkville. The staff were extremely welcoming, friendly and attentive. We also did a couples massage in the spa which was excellent, and they had a beautiful and quiet rooftop patio to lounge out on afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Our Absolute Favorite Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Money1375
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Windsor Arms a couple of year's ago and since then we stay no where else when in Toronto on business or personal. The staff are fabulous and Kevin on the front desk is the best consierge/front desk manager we have ever met. The food in Prime is superb and the waiters get better everytime we eat there. Anyone who visits Toronto, and wants to stay in style with great attention by the staff should not go any further. The Windsor Arms is tops in our books.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: hg2436
Reviews.Content: Room was very large, service was extremely good. Unlike many luxury hotels, there was no nickel and diming here, everything was first class from check-in to check-out. The butler service was also a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh, the Windsor Arms”
Reviews.Author: viperqueen
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Arms has changed over the years. It used to be more bustling, with small rooms in an excellent location. Now it is quite quiet. That's a good thing for travellers looking for a boutique hotel in the heart of Yorkville in Toronto. The service was phenomenal. Staff were fantastic. Rooms were well appointed although I've stayed in hotels that offer more. But at some point, who needs more? You must try "high tea" there. It's a wonderful experience. Overall, the Windsor Arms warms my heart.

Reviews.Title: “Service Was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JA_MA41705
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Toronto and a 2 night stay at the Windsor Arms. The Hotel is tucked away on a small street just off of Toronto's high end shopping district. It's extremely quiet and feels like an oasis despite being in the middle of the city. The service that you get at a small property like this is also just impeccable. I'd say that in many ways its better than being at home. All of the staff are very personable, friendly, and most important helpful. When I needed a cab, the doorman ran up the street to hail one down, when I expected them to pick up the phone and ask me to wait 10 minutes. When I needed a shirt pressed, I called the front desk and 20 minutes the butler had already done it.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the city”
Reviews.Author: JYREGINSTER
Reviews.Content: Lovely charming hotel, one block away from the Toronto shopping paradise. 28 spacious suites, combining elegance and technology. You feel home with all the requested luxury of an intimate real palace. The Spa and Pool give a wonderful opportunity to relax after a business day. Angelika Simon, at the concierge desk is able to manage all your requests, and always with a smile. That is where the sixth star comes from. This place is head and shoulders above all the high-end chains hotels surrounding this district, if you want to be pampered and treated as a royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ç¾Žã‚’æ±‚ã‚�ã‚‹å¿ƒ
Reviews.Content: Nice petit hotel in Toronto, located within walking distance from Metro Museum station, nearby universities and colleges. Free continental breakfast is served but do not expect what we regularly see in European hotels. Seldom to find other guests and staffs are always relaxing at the lobby. Junior suite room is spacious and comfortable with jacuzzi but not fully convenient for the business travelers with some electronic plugs which are old enough to replace.

Reviews.Title: “A Yorkville Gem”
Reviews.Author: georginatraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Windsor Arms, and after staying at several downtown hotels, I will definitely be back next time I'm in Toronto. The location is absolutely great, it's nestled away on a very quiet street, but literally a 1 minute walk to shopping on Bloor St and Yorkville. With it only being a 28-room hotel, I expected some of the service and amenities to be a little less than some of the bigger hotels, but as far as I'm concerned it was everything you'd expect from a 5-star hotel and then some. All of the staff were extremely friendly, the spa was great (with a well equipped gym, an indoor saltwater pool and tanning deck on the 5th floor) and the 24 hour butler service was extremely helpful. The drawback is that its quite expensive, but I still felt that I definitely got what I paid for. The restaurant also really lacked a "vibe" because it was quite big but fairly empty. The afternoon tea on the other hand was great!

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: TOgolf
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend spa get away. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The room made you feel like a movie star. The restaurant (Prime) was amazing, the steak was done to perfection and the homemade onion rings are a must. We live in Toronto and this is our get away paradise in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: BilgewaterBob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Windsor Arms for a few days recently and were very impressed by the staff. From the front desk to the breakfast room, everyone was very helpful and friendly, but not in that discomforting, insincere way one finds at many upper-end hotels. The location is excellent for shopping, nightlife, restaurants, etc. The only downside is that as this is a low building surrounded by highrises, none of the rooms have a view, and our room, at least, was a bit of a throwback to the 1970s. There were panels of confusing switches next to the bed that probably seemed cutting-edge 30 years ago, but at this point just seemed a bit dilapidated (and we never did figure out how to turn on the bedside lamps, or what all the mysterious buttons controlledâ€”if anything). That's really the only negative point that comes to mind. I'd definitely stay there again. By the way, what they say about famous people staying there is true. We ran into a major international movie star at breakfast one morning.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DELIGHTFUL”
Reviews.Author: montblank
Reviews.Content: My company recently decided to hold some private top level meetings off site and chose the Windsor Arms. From the moment we arrived, they took amazing care of us. The meeting facilities are very private, except for their main room. Service level was great both in the meetings as well as afterhours in the suites. Their butler service made our stay so so easy and well looked after.For a while there you get the feeling you are in some amazing European mansion . Our breaks were enjoyed in their amazing spa with a salt water pool.The rooms are almost all suites and very very spacious. Loved the stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mike7714
Reviews.Content: Visiting aunts in Toronts. From concierge requests, to room to food and spa my expectations were exceeded. Had dinner wirh family there and their organic lamb was to die for. The courtesy and care shown to my family was very professional. When away from family location allowed me to quickly get to shopping, cultural and most importanlty the feel of toronto.. Just a feel good place with the pizzaz you want went visiting Toronts.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: RS1970
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for years. I love the quaintness of the street its on.. its like having your very own luxury home in Toronto. All of the suites (and I have stayed in many) are amazing. The butler pantry in each of the rooms is a great feature, and something that very few hotels have. It lets me have my privacy while still getting great service from the hotel's five- star staff. When I have a chance to relax, I love the indoor pool with the fireplace..not to mention the place offers the best afternoon tea experience in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & Staff were beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: mvanhee
Reviews.Content: Hello Cindy & The Staff of the Windsor Arms, Thank you so much for an amazing wedding! words can not even begin to express our thanks for everything. Everyone had a wonderful time, Jeff and I the BEST!! Thank you for all your help and time and energy. Everything was flawless and classy and the food was exquisite! We received so many compliments on everything from food to service! The ceremony was beautiful, the cocktail hour was outstanding and the reception was perfect! I know the whole process was easier and smoother because of you and your amazing staff at the Windsor Arms. I am so grateful that you took such great care of everyone that we love. Thank You! Sincerely, Michele & Jeff McCabe Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous Time - would (and WILL) do it again!”
Reviews.Author: circa1970
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Windsor Arms for a 40th birthday celebration. We had an absolutely fabulous time...so much so we didn't leave the hotel all night (just ordered room service after room service - so good!). The rooms were spacious...beds were super comfortable and music is piped in every room! The staff was amazing (a special shout out to Kevin and Sal) - we felt like they were there just for us! To top it off, we had tea in the purple room the next day. The scones...in one word: delicious! There is so much food that we couldn't eat it all (so they gave us take-home containers!). When my grandparents used to come town they chose the Windsor Arms as their hotel of choice (our house was too small to fit them!)...now I finally know why. Given the option, I wouldn't stay anywhere else either. p.s. if you order room service, try the calamari!

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveller_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Arms for a weekend getaway with my boyfriend and had the most spectacular experience imaginable. I had heard wonderful things about the hotel from friends who had stayed there, and after discovering that it had been ranked as one of the top 5 boutique hotels internationally by Conde Naste Traveller - a publication I read religiously - I figured I simply had to visit it! The beds are amazing - the experience of sleeping in these clouds trumps even the sofitel in Paris! The restaurant, a steakhouse, just launched a new vegan menu which, for a vegan such as myself, is a dream come true. I live in Manhattan and frequent the vegan spots on the UES and in the Village and nothing compares to the hearts of palm fries and the glazed tofu dish at the Windsor Arms. Also, I decided to treat myself to a full body massage at the spa during my stay which was SPECTACULAR. The staff are the hotel are all so incredibly kind and friendly (they catered to our every need and whim), and the rooms are insanely spacious... I could not imagine staying anywhere else when I next travel to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, luxurious, superior service”
Reviews.Author: MaZDaGiRL7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a special celebration night with my partner, and it surpassed our romantic and indulgent criteria. The room was huge, with all kinds of neat bells and whistles (like sound piped into every room, with separate controls in each room). The service was impeccable, and the staff made me feel as though we were the only couple to attend to in the whole hotel! We had dinner in the Prime restaurant downstairs, which I had read some less than favourable reviews about on this site, but we were treated extremely well there (perhaps because it was a Tuesday, and the place was practically empty helped us out there). We ordered room-service for breakfast, which was incredible!! By far the most decadent and accommodating hotel I've ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: mama0105
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto about once a month for business, and there is nowhere I'd rather stay than here. Walking into the Windsor Arms after a tough day with clients is like coming home to a warm family. The staff is kind and funny and genuinely caring. It's been a while since I have been able to stay there due to meeting schedules, but it really is just wonderful and I look forward to going back! The bed is super comfy. I sleep so well there. The rooms are gorgeous. I've never eaten in the restaurant, but room service is very good. And high tea is nice! I would highly recommend this to anyone going.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary1938
Reviews.Content: Lovely small luxury hotel with character situated on a quiet street right off Bloor - so convenient to shops. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful with valet parking and welcoming back to the hotel. We were upgraded at no charge on check-in to a larger sunny room with sitting area and two flat screen TVs. The Windsor Arms holds wonderful afternoon teas which are extremely popular - in their very attractive tea room. All-in-all a very pleasing stay. Our two disappointments were the morning continental breakfast where we were served with lukewarm tea and the outrageous cost of room service to bring two continental breakfasts to one room at a service charge of $24!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Experience Did not Live up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: maltamark
Reviews.Content: It seems that something must have gone downhill in recent months at the Windsor Arms because we've heard such great things about it. Every local we met told us how stars stay at the hotel when in town. In fact, we even saw a famous actor in the elevator one day. The sad thing is that this charming hotel in a great location has such great potential but falls flat on its face in delivery. For the price-point, one expects pampering and near perfection. Here is where the hotel fell flat: 1. Our suite was worn and dirty (and, yes, after a few days we complained to management whose remedy was to send the housekeeping supervisor and a cheap bottle of wine to our room): Much of the furniture had ring marks on it, certain items hadn't been dusted in months, the curtains didn't hang correctly (my partner fixed them himself finally), the sofa smelled like urine. . . 2. The bedding was nothing special: most hotels now have pillow tops and luxurious bedding. The Windsor Arms bed had no padding. We called to ask if they had anything and all they had was a foam top, which helped somewhat but not much. 3. Service in all aspects of the hotel was inconsistent: The housekeeper would sometimes leave a certain number of towels, sometimes not; sometimes there would be slippers and the customary mat by the bed at turn-down sometimes not. Sometimes they would replace dirty drinking glasses, sometimes not. 4. The restaurant is pretty subpar (only ate breakfast and lunch there) and, as another reviewer alludes to, there is this server that they must have hired from diner in the middle of the country. You think, how on earth did she get a job here? That all said, most of the front desk staff were gems and so was Damon, the concierge/bellhop, who was friendly and very knowledgeable of his recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, terrible hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Nicolai1960
Reviews.Content: I booked the romance package at $700 for our 15 year anniversary. For that price had high expectations. What a disappointment. The staff were shabbily dressed and generally inattentive. The spa host was unfriendly, but the spa staff were excellent and we did have a terrific couples massage. Out room was nice, but definitely underwhelming, for the price. The package included champagne, but it was just a glass each. I would have overlooked this mediocre, nickle and dine hotel experience if not for the breakfast. All we were offered during the breakfast were some muffins, danishes and croissants by a very unfriendly waitress. I cannot believe that there any sane management personnel would allow someone like this to work at their so called high end establishment. When my wife asked for a croissant, she was told they were out. For $700, how can you be out? No apologies, nothing. Then I asked if I needed to sign anything when we were ready to leave, to which she responded with a shake of here head and walked off. talk about the royal treatment. Not!!! Furthermore, I booked the Windsor Arms because the website says they have a piano bar, which is open on Wednesday Thursday nights, I believe. It includes a tapas menu as well. We were very much looking forward to attending. However they replaced the piano bar with a tea room over a year ago, but the web site still have not been changed to reflect that change. Unbelievable to say the least. When I brought it up with the hotel, they just blew me off. I would never have booked if I have known there was no piano bar. I would have instead booked the Park Hyatt. Talk about regret. Trust me. Do not go to this horrible join. We ended up checking out and going to Jack Astors for lunch. The service was outstanding from start to finish and the bill was $23. Hmmm.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: beanerOhio
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Windsor Arms was perfect from beginning to end. I can't remember every one, but I can mention by name a few of the friendly and excellent staff who made my stay a treat: Melinda, Slavy, Neil, Damon, Edgar. And the gentleman who made me American iced tea each morning in Prime. Oh, and the bartender who walked my big snifter of Bailey's across the lobby so I wouldn't have to. Thank you. Thank you. The location is excellent for business and the valet parking (with in & out privileges) is ideal. The internet service works perfectly--I had everything I needed for a successful business trip. On another note, there were touches that made me feel spoiled to be away on business: wonderful jetted tub that filled very quickly, different turndown amenities each night, Molton Brown products, a comfortable sitting area and a cozy bed. And a butler's closet.

Reviews.Title: “Underpriced and overlooked”
Reviews.Author: TProud
Reviews.Content: A great gem in Yorkville! I am a Toronto native that moved away a couple years ago and am constantly looking for a great place to stay when I return. I am glad to say that I have found the comfort and great service that most Toronto hotels lack (along with a good price tag to match). I switched rooms a few times because the hotel was quite full and with each room I was very satisfied. They are all comfortable with large beds, seperate shower with large jacuzzi tubs, free internet, lots of tv channels and butlers who are truely helpful to tend to you during your stay. I also loved that they were willing to open the gym and pool 24/7 because I can be quite a night owl. Room service was always tasty too! Definitly give it a try next time you're thinking of the Four Seasons or Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...not incredible.”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night. As a SLH member, they upgraded our room to a suite upon arrival. Gave us early check-in as well. Front desk, valet and butler service reps. were all very friendly and efficient. Areas for improvement at this hotel are: room service; food not the greateast we have had at fine hotels although the steak from Prime Restaurant was good. Pool area needed cleaning and servicing. No towels and the sauna floors were dirty and stained. Overall: the indoor pool is better the Four Seasons Toronto and the hotel is small and cozy. Would not stay here once the Ritz Carlton or the Shangri-La Hotel opens next year. This hotel along with a few others are going to need some serious face lifting if they want to compete with newer first class Toronto hotels that are coming onto the market in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SocratesCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for a getaway in this charming hotel. We were upgraded to their Corner Suite which was beautifully and tastefully decorated. Very comfortable with a luxury bathroom and a large jacuzzi tub. The room service food was delicious. The staff - butler, front desk, housekeeping, front door - was gracious and seemed devoted to our comfort. I highly recommend this unique boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “who owns that piece of neglect”
Reviews.Author: gailjay
Reviews.Content: Windsor arms is the worst hotel in the best location the owner must be ignorant and not noticing the dirt,filth ,service is null..

Reviews.Title: “The most elegant hotel in the city. Without a doubt.”
Reviews.Author: Manhattanite21
Reviews.Content: I live in Manhattan and I travel to Toronto just about every month, I always insist on staying at the Windsor Arms. Although I've been in love with the hotel for years and years, I have forced myself to stay at some of these others, The Four Seasons, the new Hazelton, I've stayed at just about every 'top' hotel in the city and simply, none of them compare. First of all, the staff at the Windsor Arms are absolutely wonderful, I genuinely look forward to arriving and greeting Slavy or Damien at the door, checking in with Kevin, and being served by Dey at brunch and Anthony at dinner. Which brings me to my next point of praise - the food. It is absolutely fantastic. As a vegetarian with quite specific dining requests, I really appreciate just how accommodating the kitchen is, they never fail to satisfy my most bizarre meal requests, sometime even at the most ridiculous hours of the evening. I really do consider the hotel to be a home-away-from-home; it is truly a place, where after just one or two days, everyone does know your name and is eager to welcome you back. Although the hotel embodies a sense of timeless class, I love how it always seems to be changing and expanding. Recently, they just redecorated the tea room (where they serve the most amazing tea, and the most delicious scones, a stay would not be complete without indulging in them) and built the new steakhouse which is decorated with the most interesting works of art, a detail much appreciated by an avid art collector like myself. Overall, the place is wonderful. My one complaint -- they're always packed during the film festival, forcing me to book far, far far too far in advance to reserve a room. However, after trying almost every other hotel, and after so many pleasant stays at the Windsor Arms, I could not fathom staying anywhere anymore; the Windsor Arms truly is my Canadian home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very nice, posh”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: While I wouldn't go back for dinner. This is a lovely small hotel to stay in. The rooms are new and huge (one bedroom suite). Good location off of Bloor and the afternoon tea in the lounge is great! Very old fashioned and good service too!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Artravels_8
Reviews.Content: NEVER AGAIN will I stay at this over-rated hotel. The room prices are atrocious for a so-called 5-star hotel. Greeting at the door was nice. Front desk amicable. Very ghostly feeling with no punch to this hotel. The setting dull, old. Looks like they have let the Arms go. When my wife and I went into the steak restaurant we were greeted with an abrupt 'we are not open'. Not an inviting atmosphere. Staff were hospitable but felt as if they were not entirely FOR the hotel. I would never ever go back. Again the room prices do NOT justify the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best”
Reviews.Author: thebestoftoronto
Reviews.Content: I enjoy trying different hotels in my travels. As I visit Toronto frequently, it is easy for me to try different properties, especially since Toronto has gotten a few new hotels in the past year or two. Well, all I can say that trying different properties is not something I plan on doing again. There is absolutely nothing that compares to the Windsor Arms. It's a true boutique hotel with an amazing location, service and facilities. The Spa is incredible, the Bar is fun and the new restaurant, steak house, is the best. The Hotel suites are fab, spacious and sophisticated. None of this cheap and trendy stuff here. Had a great time, staff knows my preferances and chatting with an A list movie star that tells me he always stays here just rounded out a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better :-)”
Reviews.Author: Casserole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Arms for 2 nights December 21st & 22nd, 2007 in a 2 bedroom suite. Check in was fast and friendly and we were escorted up to our suite (412) by a staff member who showed us where everything was (ie) the many light and sound controls throughout. In our room there was a plate of Christmas Cookies waiting for us. The suite was very comfortable with a living room, with wide screen TV, master bedroom with wide screen TV, second bedroom with 2 twin beds, bathroom with shower and ensuite bathroom with jacuzzi tub. The suite was spotless and well kept with everything you might need, the beds had whote fluffy duvets and there were plenty of towels, soaps, lotions etc and 4 robes for the 4 of us. The doorman and front desk staff were all friendly & welcoming, room service was quick and efficient. We liked the location of the Windsor Arms just tucked away on a quiet street off busy Bloor Street and it's trendy shopping. The hotel assisted us with luggage storage on our check out day and with restaurant reservations prior to arrival. We highly recommend the Windsor Arms.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the spa”
Reviews.Author: RosaSalerno
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my visit to the Windsor Arms spa. It's on the 4th and 5th floors of the hotel and has a lovely indoor pool and sauna. The services at the spa were great and the estheticians were quite good. The waiting area is quite small, but there is also a full gym and a terrace that you can enjoy in the summer. They can also order lunch in and there is an area where you can sit and eat it. The spa was quiet and serene and not crazy busy, so it was a nice place to relax. My husband and I had a couples massage in a room with running water and side by side tables. Very relaxing. We then sat by the pool and enjoyed swimming in it together. It was a great way to spend the afternoon and just relax. i would definitely go back and do recommend the spa to others.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay but prefer other hotels in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: flyingpheonix
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite in this hotel in March 2006. The hotel is very small and has a boutique feel. It's quite intimate and quiet compared to many hotels in Toronto. The room was lovely and very relaxing. The service was good but not comparable to the Park Hyatt or Four Seasons. The spa is nice but certainly nowhere near as nice as the Park Hyatt's Stillwater Spa. All in all, we had a nice stay but I wouldn't return at those prices ($600 for the suite). The Four Seasons and Park Hyatt in Toronto have better rates, amenities, restaurants and service.

Reviews.Title: “Should have read the reviews first”
Reviews.Author: tipps2
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews first before allowing my travel agent to book me in at this hotel. It was the worst stay I have ever experienced in my life. It started upon my arrival with no doorman and having to bring my own bags in. There was three people standing at the front desk and no one offered to help, further more upon check-in the three people seemed more like a comedy act than a front desk. I was not escorted to my room nor asked if i would like to be escorted or needed help with my luggage. Upon entering my room I noticed a pungent smell. The room appeared clean but was soon to find this was far from the truth. There was fresh lipstick on the duvet. I strongly recommend that would be travellers rethink their stay at this particular hotel. I have informed my travel agent of my disapproval so she does not make the same mistake twice. Another thing to note is this hotel says it is a four star, it is not, it has a three star rating, which is still too high of a rating.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this hotel while in Toronto and have always received superb service and attention from the helpful staff. Granted, no place could be perfect but I just love the low key settings of this small personable hotel. Definitely prefer it over other two nearby 5 stars as I've stayed at both and none can come close to this place in terms of service. Kevin and Olevia at concierge have consistently taken care of all my needs. I can tell you the lobby is quiet small, so with functions going on they may appear over crowded but it is all part of this place's old school charm. The rooms itself are furnished beautifully. Some are now equipped with LCD TVs and I think they should do away with the tube TVs in other rooms. Panasonic Tao might have been a big hit 7 years ago but getting rid of the bulky TV replacing it with flat TV will go a long way in keeping the hotel's luxury status. There is nightly entertainment during the weekend at the excellent club 22 if you're ever bored and food is overall excellent but there is also a plethora of fine dining places whit in 5 minutes walking distance. Definitely a cut above rest in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: colorpurple
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Windsor Arms over the past 2 years. The last time was just after the New year. This place is really amazing. The staff are so helpful. The spa is like an oasis in the city. The finest of services that i ever had, were more than matched by the attentive and professional spa staff. The pool with the fireplace is so relaxing and the couples massage room has a real waterfall. My spouse and I really enjoyed the spa treatments. The rooms are large and not too fussy. The food in the restaurant is amazing and the Tea Room is the best i ever had. Even better than the Plaza in New York, before it shut. Cheap its not BUT you definitely get your money's worth. The concierge staff even arranged a shopping excursion for us as our luggage arrived a day after we did. Great Hotel at a Great Location. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Stay At the Windsor Arms”
Reviews.Author: tennissdeaf
Reviews.Content: The staff were true professionals in every respect and very accomodating. The rooms were spacious and decorated beautifully. The beds were so comfortable that I slept like a baby. The bathrooms were unbelievable! When I wanted to relax , my room was so peaceful..When I wanted entertainment. the bar was extraordinary. The Windsor Arms is the place to stay when visiting Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “A felt like a true VIP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visit Toronto at least once a month and usually stay at the Four Seasons. On my last visit the Windsor Arms was recommended to me by a resturant in the area - I am extremely glad they shared this "Gem" with me. From the moment I arrived to the moment I left I was treated as though I was the most important person in the world - and I am - to me. I cannot imagine staying anywhere elsenow. The rates are higher than most hotels but you pay for what you get. I loved the personal attention I got from all the staff and found them to be personable and responsive to my needs. I highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stiff and cheesy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is acceptable. The rooms are large, if a bit conservative (they would have been cutting edge 80 years ago when art deco was just emerging). The bathroom was very nice, but again, it left me feeling a bit cold. The overall feeling is of a hotel that was embalmed. The cause of this may be that they are stretching to make the hotel fee older than it is. The reality is that the original Windsor Arms was torn down: this is a copy of the original except for one fireplace that was retained. They talk about entering through "our century old portals" which are really about 10 years old. This effort leads to some laughably cheesy moments: the elevators are done up as a library. But of course there is not any room for books. Instead, they have cut the spines off of a bunch of old books and glued them to the walls. They then covered the spines with glass doors and locked them (to keep us for stealing the spines no doubt). Beyond this, I had the feeling that they see their guests as resources to be mined for every possible dollar. Regardless of how much money one has, no one wants to feel this way. As an example, I called down and asked for two wine glasses to be brought to the room. When I checked out, I noticed that I had been charged $9.32 plus tax for this honour. I was outraged. I stay in luxury hotels all the time, and I have never been charged for the use of a glass. I expressed my indignation politely to the front desk staff and he simply looked at me, without saying a word. I waited for a few seconds, expecting something. When I realized that he was just going to stand there and look at me, I signed the invoice. I now regret this decision. I should have taken a stand against this petty exploitation. I would far rather stay in the four seasons, Hyatt or the Germain (a truly innovative hotel experience).

Reviews.Title: “They don't make ear plugs big enough”
Reviews.Author: hr2011London
Reviews.Content: Needs to decide whether it is a luxury hotel or a night club. Despite their protestations, we cannot have been the first to complain about the thumping base on party nights - all the way to the top floor - nowhere to hide. I do not believe they do not know so must assume that they simply do not care. Lots of "we'll turn it down" but they didn't and definitely put the needs of the zillions of wedding guests before their room guests. Also, on private party nights, key facilities - the bar and the dining room - are closed. Not that anyone mentioned that when I phoned in advance to make a dinner reservation. "You don't need to reserve if you're a guest" they said - the real reason is that there was no room at the inn. And corridors packed with drunken boars, shouting in time to the thumping bass is not really what I pay top rate room prices to enjoy. Just don't.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Again the noise is a real problem here - much worse is the patronizing attitude of the owner when you have had a night ruined because of the bass from a private party which ran long into the night, and the half-truths from the staff about how long the noise would go on, as well as numerous other glitches in the service which you shouldn't suffer in a relatively expensive 'boutique' hotel. Perhaps the priority of the management should be with the guests staying at the hotel, but this doesn't appear to be the case. I couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: jhoetjes
Reviews.Content: I stay in toronto on business yearly and have stayed at the Windsor Arms more than once. it is true to make sure you are not in the 2 rooms directly over the lounge(it gets noisy). the rooms are awesome. the sound system goes throughout the room including controls in the bathroom. the linens and the pillows are all the best I've ever seen in a hotel. the lounge was quite relaxing after a day working each evening. a real nice atmosphere and the live entertainment was great. the staff takes care of all needs that arise at any time of day or night. I recommend the Windsor Arms over the Four Seasons or Park Hyatt. which are the 2 closest to it in quality in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My companion and I were put into a room directly above the dance floor and band, which band ran loud and long. Registered complaint, but all we got was a sneering smile and a shrug.. Since my companion and I usually stay at the Four Seasons, we found here (on a trial basis) a (relatively) poor choice of properties. Suggest that if one is bound on staying in this property, so stipulate that they NOT ACCEPT A ROOM ON THE SECOND FLOOR ABOVE THEIR DANCE FLOOR.

Reviews.Title: “feel like a star!!”
Reviews.Author: hello24
Reviews.Content: Pricier than the Hyatt or Four Seasons, but this IS the IN PLACE for all the stars in town for filming and such. Because of the minimum number of rooms they have, it is very cozy. the lounge is a great place for live music. the rooms and staff are better than all others in town. I will be back.
